General Emergency Questions.greeting: Hello! Please describe your emergency so I can assist you.
General Emergency Questions.assistance: Iâ€™m here to assist. What kind of emergency are you experiencing?
General Emergency Questions.emergency_number: Dial 112 for emergency services in most countries. Check your local emergency number.
General Emergency Questions.response_time: Response times depend on traffic and emergency priority. Stay calm and wait for help.
General Emergency Questions.cancellation: If this is an error, please call emergency services directly to confirm cancellation.
General Emergency Questions.safe_place: Find a secure place, remain calm, and avoid dangerous areas until help arrives.

Ambulance Related Queries.ambulance_arrival: An ambulance is on its way. Keep the patient stable and monitor breathing.
Ambulance Related Queries.cpr: Check for breathing. If absent, perform CPR while waiting for paramedics.
Ambulance Related Queries.heart_attack: Have the patient stay calm, chew aspirin if available, and avoid physical exertion.
Ambulance Related Queries.seizure: Do not restrain them. Move objects away to prevent injury and place them on their side after the seizure stops.
Ambulance Related Queries.choking: Encourage coughing. If they cannot breathe, perform abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver).
Ambulance Related Queries.fracture: Immobilize the area, do not move the injured limb, and wait for medical help.
Ambulance Related Queries.burns: Run cool water over the burn for 10 minutes. Do not apply ice or ointments.
Ambulance Related Queries.poisoning: Do not induce vomiting unless instructed by poison control. Seek urgent medical help.
Ambulance Related Queries.allergic_reaction: If the person has an EpiPen, use it immediately. Call emergency services.
Ambulance Related Queries.medical_emergency: Medical assistance is on the way. Stay calm and describe the symptoms in detail.
Ambulance Related Queries.asthma_attack: Encourage the person to sit upright, stay calm, and take slow breaths. If they have an inhaler, let them use it.
Ambulance Related Queries.stroke: Call emergency services immediately. If available, help them chew aspirin and stay calm.
Ambulance Related Queries.unconscious_person: Check if they are breathing. If not, perform CPR while waiting for emergency help.

Fire Brigade Related Queries.fire_emergency: Evacuate immediately and do not use elevators. The fire brigade is on its way.
Fire Brigade Related Queries.gas_leak: Do not turn on any electrical appliances. Open windows, evacuate, and call emergency services.
Fire Brigade Related Queries.small_fire: Use a fire extinguisher only if the fire is small. If spreading, evacuate immediately.
Fire Brigade Related Queries.smoke_inhalation: Stay low to avoid smoke, cover your nose with a damp cloth, and wait for firefighters.
Fire Brigade Related Queries.electrical_fire: Do not use water. Cut the power if safe and use a Class C fire extinguisher.

Police Related Queries.police_arrival: Police are on their way. Find a safe place and do not engage with suspects.
Police Related Queries.robbery: Do not resist. Try to note details about the suspect and report to the police immediately.
Police Related Queries.assault: Get to a safe location and call the police immediately. Do not confront the attacker alone.
Police Related Queries.missing_person: Report the missing person to the police with their last known location and description.
Police Related Queries.suspicious_activity: Report any unusual behavior to the authorities. Stay vigilant and avoid risky situations.
Police Related Queries.stolen_items: Report lost valuables to the police. Check lost-and-found departments nearby.

Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.earthquake: Drop, cover, and hold on. Stay indoors if safe or move to an open area away from buildings.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.flood: Move to higher ground immediately. Avoid driving or walking through floodwaters.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.hurricane: Secure loose objects, stay indoors, and follow official weather updates for evacuation instructions.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.first_aid_kit: A first aid kit should include bandages, antiseptic, pain relievers, gloves, and emergency contact info.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.snake_bite: Stay still, keep the affected area below heart level, and seek medical help immediately.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.wound_care: Wash the wound with soap and water, apply antiseptic, and seek medical help if needed.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.panic_attack: Take deep breaths, assess the situation logically, and focus on necessary actions.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.disaster_preparedness: Have a go-bag ready, know your local emergency numbers, and have an emergency plan in place.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.lost_person: Stay where you are if safe, use landmarks for orientation, and call for assistance if possible.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.helping_others: Ensure your safety first, call emergency services, and provide first aid if trained.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.chemical_spill: Leave the area immediately, cover your nose with a cloth, and avoid breathing in smoke.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.power_outage: Use flashlights instead of candles, unplug electrical devices, and stay updated on the outage status.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.tsunami: Move to higher ground immediately and stay away from coastal areas.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.biological_hazard: Stay indoors, close all windows, and follow official instructions on decontamination.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.avalanche: Try to stay on top, create an air pocket around your face, and signal for rescuers.
Miscellaneous Serious Emergency Question.building_collapse: If trapped, cover your mouth to avoid dust, stay still, and tap on objects to alert rescuers.
